item.title: Loading Data
item.description: read.table readr Other formats? read.table This should be one of the first functions you learn, it allows for adhoc data entry: data<- read.table(header= TRUE, text=" name age Homer 45 Marge 43 Bart 13 Lisa 11 Maggie 2 ") data ## name age ## 1 Homer 45 ## 2 Marge 43 ## 3 Bart 13 ## 4 Lisa 11 ## 5 Maggie 2 Saving data as a csv is a very common operation, as this format can be opened in any text editor, sql client and/or analysis software including excel.
